page.title: 17CLEATOR - THE VILLAGE
page.content:
Cleator has existed for far longer than any other settlement in the block.Caesar Caine, the vicar of St Leonard's Church,Cleator, in the the 1920's wrote a lengthy book about Cleator and Cleator Moor, and in it he gives reasons for thinking that a church may have existed on the site since the 5th century.
The village consists of a main road with terraces of small houses with no gardens along either side. Housing is certainly unique in this area. Most of it was put up quickly and cheaply to house the mine workers and their families. They had no bathrooms, indoor toilets or gardens, although most have now been modernised.
Cleator has a sewage works, a garden centre, a factory and a nearby lake.
